titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Lefferts Family Papers
circa 1849-1925
MS 379
titlestmt.author: Elise Winks

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-12 14:17:47 -0400.

did.abstract:
Papers, correspondence, account books, genealogical material and printed matter of various members of the Lefferts family of New York City and Long Island. In particular, the papers relate to Marshall Lefferts, his wife, Mary Allen Lefferts, their sons, Marshall Clifford and William Henry Lefferts, and William Henry's wife, Edith Crane Lefferts, and their son Barent Lefferts. The papers of Marshall Lefferts contain material relating to his involvement in obtaining an British patent for Thomas A. Edison's "Electric Pen and Duplicating Press," including several letters from Edison.
To request this material for research, and for fuller information about it, please follow this link to the record in N-YHS's catalog, Bobcat: Lefferts family papers
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.
